results.title: Viney
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: India”
A film depicting the daily domestic life of Viney Gupta - a young Hindu housewife living in a comfortable section of New Delhi. Viney’s marriage was arranged by her parents with her meeting her husband once before the engagement.

results.title: Vindhya Pradesh
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani, Films Division, Government of India and Mushir Ahmad
results.brief_description: The State of Vindhya Pradesh includes 26 of the 36 former principalities of Central India. This film deals with the development of the State and the people who depend on the diamond and limestone mines for their living. Also presents sidelights of its great historical past.
results.creator_credit_for_label: M. Bhavnani, Films Division, Government of India and Mushir Ahmad

results.title: Vincent Van Gogh
results.brief_description: Van Gogh’s life story, the development of his work and his struggle against madness and poverty told by excerpts from his letters to his beloved brother, Theo. The artist’s paintings and scenes taken at localities in which he lived and worked provide the visual material. Shows his early drawings, his move to Paris, his time in Arles and Saintes-Maries and his enthusiasm for the southern landscape, his time in hospitals at Arles and Saint-Remy, Gauguin’s visit, and Van Gogh’s final sojourn with a doctor in Auvers near Paris.

results.title: Villages of the lake district
results.brief_description: This documentary style production seeks out the fascinating history lying in the many villages tucked away within the district. Join W. R. Mitchell M.B.E. as he visits lakes around the villages of Rydal, Grasmere, Wasdale, Grange in Borrowdale, Troutbeck, Hartsop, Askham, Dacre, Hawkshead, Sawrey and many others. Take in the splendour of village life and the breathtaking scenery.

results.title: Village of the rain forest, Nigeria
results.creator_credit: Juniper Films and Tristram Wilson Productions
results.brief_description:
We see through the eyes of children one village in this land of eighty million, touched by the strong tide of change. The village stands for tradition while the cities represents modernity. The wealth which has transformed the cities must now be harnessed to the betterment of rural life, to give balance and sustenance to all Nigerians.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Village of Switzerland
results.creator_credit: Churchill-Wexler Film Productions and Gunther V. Fritsch
results.brief_description:
Depicts life in a typical mountain village in Switzerland. Includes scenes of farm chores, town hall meetings and festivals.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Village of idiots
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Michael Scott, David Verrall, Eugene Fedorenko and Rose Newlove
results.brief_description: Based on a Jewish folk tale, this animated short tells the story of a Shmendrik, a lovable fool who leaves his village on a circuitous quest for knowledge. The story of Shmendrik’s new life and its uncanny closeness to his old life offers a humorous take on people’s tendency to romanticize what they don’t have. Co-directors Fedorenko and Newlove filmed paper cut-outs on layers of glass to achieve unique, textured visuals.

results.title: Village Life in Tonga
results.creator_credit: ACI Productions, Tony Ganz and Rhoden Streeter
results.brief_description:
A documentary filmed in the village of Hoi showing the rhythm of daily life, including farming, fishing, preparation of food and social relationships in the South Pacific islands of Tonga.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
